comments:
Build id: I20070625-1500

I had this bug just after asking for a synchronize.

I have no idea how to reproduce it.


-- Error Log --
Date: Wed Aug 22 14:21:14 CEST 2007
Message: An internal error occurred during: "Synchronize View: Processing label changes".
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.core.jobs
Stack Trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.AbstractSynchronizeModelProvider.isRootProvider(AbstractSynchronizeModelProvider.java:707)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.AbstractSynchronizeModelProvider.reset(AbstractSynchronizeModelProvider.java:312)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.SynchronizeModelUpdateHandler.processEvent(SynchronizeModelUpdateHandler.java:233)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler.processEvents(BackgroundEventHandler.java:369)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.core.BackgroundEventHandler$1.run(BackgroundEventHandler.java:203)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
I can't reproduce this bug. Could you give me more information about context of this bug?

(In reply to comment #1)
> I can't reproduce this bug. Could you give me more information about context of
> this bug? 

Well i had one Java project opened, and i thing i asked for synchronization of my local project with the HEAD.

I assume you have the Team>CVS>Synchronize/Compare preference "Allow models to participate..." preference disabled. This is not the default and, although we still support disabling the preference, there are known issues which we do not plan on addressing since we are focusing our efforts on supporting logical models and this particular issue doesn;t have negative side effects.

(In reply to comment #3)
> I assume you have the Team>CVS>Synchronize/Compare preference "Allow models to
> participate..." preference disabled. This is not the default and, although we
> still support disabling the preference, there are known issues which we do not
> plan on addressing since we are focusing our efforts on supporting logical
> models and this particular issue doesn;t have negative side effects.
> 

Well right now, this preference is enabled. But i did move from 3.3 to 3.4M1, so maybe it got enabled when i moved. I kept the same workspace when i moved, so i don't know what could happen.
